descriptionSet.description: On this advertisement for M.A. Joshi & Co. fine art colour printing a letter with a comic of an Indian king dominates the upper section. The image of a princess and a fair skinned couple can be seen in the the lower section. A detailed explanation about the advertised services as well as contact details are pictured as well. The right side was not scanned completeyl so some parts of the text can't be read.

inscription.text: When rajas write letters, you'll find they are fond of using exclusively Basildon Bond Available in all popular forms & sizes Stockists Thacker & Co. Ltd Bombay Spencer & Co. Ltd Madras W. Newman & Co. Ltd. Calcutta Manufacturers John Dickinson & Co. Ltd. (Incorporated in England) Where comfort and convenience combine Fine Art Colour Printing By the new process specially studied in Europe by Mr. M.A. Joshi and employed by him at his press, the Ravi Udaya-Vijaya Fine Art Offset Works of Ghatkopar, (near Bombay) Mr. M.A. Joshi At the Ravin Udaya-Vijaya Fine Art Offset Works, long famed for its excellent Lithographic productions, has been introduced, for the first time in India, the new process of coloured Photo-lithography, which our Mr. Joshi studied in Europe and which has considerably raised the standard of our work; the press, now equipped with modern machinery, is the best litho-press in India. Mr. Joshi trained under the famous Indian artist, Raja Ravi Varma and completed his studies in Europe. His works have won numerous awards - Gold, Silver and Bronze medals, Certificates of Merit and Cash Prizes - and were very highly commended at Wembley Exhibition. Offset printing a speciality; also the printing of pictures, Calendars, Posters Mill labels and all other commercial colour productions. (By appointment to H.E. The Rt. Hon'ble Lord Brabourne, Governor of Bombay.) M.A. Joshi & Co., Frame Makers. Prop., The Ravi Udaya Vijaya Fine Art Offset Works. 147-149, Shastri Bldg., Opp. Water Tank, Princess St. Bombay The Ritz Centrally located amid eyquisite surroundings, the is to-day Calcutta's leading hotel. For terms, apply to the manager, 3, Harrington St., Calcutta. Telephone: P.K. 1373. Telegrams: "Ritzie" Discerning tourists, people of distinction visit Calcutta, stay at Ritze which caters [...] for the comfort and [...] satisfaction of its guests.
